fields.description:

fields.summary: Unable to view Plan in REST

fields.description:
This optional choice should enable the user to 
'keep the last N _successful_ builds'
'keep all failing builds in the last 3 days'

when build expiry is run.
fields.summary: Add optional condition to plan Build expiry rules to keep successful/failed builds only

fields.description:
The logic for calculating agents names e.g. "CentOS (123)" loops through all persisted agents until it finds a matching name. Then it loops through the again.

The logic can be optimised fairly significantly.

It can cause agents registration to fail if this takes > 60s
fields.summary: Resolution of duplicate agent names performs at O^n

fields.description:
Since most (all?) build artifacts are static, and probably never change once they are created, Bamboo should set the "Last Modified" header when serving any artifact.
The timestamp from the file stored on disk could be used, or if that is unavailable - the time stamp of when the build finished?

!http://img.skitch.com/20090819-me3phuunma1um3acd6jpdddkxt.jpg!

Large artifacts such as the JSON needed for Clover's new Tree Map could greatly benefit from browsers doing the needful caching.
fields.summary: Set the "Last Modified" header for artifacts, so browsers can cache static resources

fields.description:
Brydie to provide details on how:

- change detection works
- how checkout works when several remote agents are involved
- limitations
- workarounds.
fields.summary: Update Docs with a clear statement on how Bamboo and Perforce integrate, including limitations.

fields.description:
When I click "Re-order" in the Build Queue on Safari 4, the re-order controls flicker briefly, then the page re-draws with two rows of Dashboard tabs and no other content. (See attached screen shot)

It works OK in Firefox 3.5.
fields.summary: Queue re-ordering doesn't work in Safari 4
Multi-Plan gadgets - Disable or hide the favourites option when there are no favourites
Multi-Plan gadgets - "Use Favourites" option should be selected by default

fields.description:
Currently there is the field group by which not only controls the group by but also which graph is displayed.

We should change the name of this field to "Graph Type" (or similar) and the options available should be written like.
graphA - group by Day
graphA - group by Auto
graphB - group by build
(obviously with good graph names in place)

Essentially at the moment this is all a bit weird
fields.summary: Plan summary gadget - changes to config options
Thumbnail still not working for plan summary gadget (thumbnail exists in source, but not being loaded - probably just a type or something)
plan status gadget - plans don't seem to be ordered (order can be different each time it is loaded)
Gadget footer (all gadgets) should href the server url so you can click on it
Plan status gadget requires the standard Bamboo footer (containing server information)
Heading for plan summary gadget is inconsistent - should not contain bamboo server information

fields.description: Confluence need Maven 2.1.0 specifically to build confluence.
fields.summary: Please make a Maven 2.1.0 builder available on the EC2 image

fields.description: The purpose for the feature is to allow SOAP calls on JIRA to be trusted apps calls.
fields.summary: Plugin point for adding headers etc into axis SOAP calls
UserPicker on Global Permission page returns undefined string

fields.description:
There are both advanced and very simple Clover gadgets written during ShipIt attack of the Gadgets, looking for a good server home.
see also: CLOV-561

This could be a quick win piece of low hanging fruit.

Lets start with the simplest form of Clover gadget: "Display the Red/Green Clover Coverage bar".
e.g.
!http://img.skitch.com/20090824-ti2wwfuet8mfaqpw8hiw8h6k8a.jpg!

This gadget will:
 * pull the coverage data from a user specified Artifact (that is a Clover HTML report) from the latest Bamboo build for a specified Bamboo Plan
 * render a red/green coverage bar showing the percentage of code coverage for a specific project
 * display the raw total percentage figure
 * support all gadget display sizes

If the Artifact points to the root directory of a Clover HTML report, then the gadget can assume there will be a 'project.js' available.
e.g. http://clover.atlassian.com/browse/webtest/project.js

If the Artifact points to a single .js file (presumably project.js), the gadget should just use it as the data source.

An example gadget (done during ShipIt 10) is available on Labs: http://labs.atlassian.com/browse/GOGO .
The sub-project 'clover' contains the gadget: http://labs.atlassian.com/svn/GOGO/trunk/src/clover/ .
This gadget is actually deployed and can be installed in any Open Social container. The URL is: http://labs.atlassian.com/gadgets/npellow/src/clover-gadget.xml

This gadget also uses the historical json to generate a visualization of coverage and project metric trends. This can be added to the gadget for a phase #2.
fields.summary: Expose a single Clover Gadget via Bamboo

fields.description: possibly in an iframe, on both the build page, and the PLAN page (show latest).
fields.summary: embed Clover's HTML reports into the Clover panel in the Bamboo plugin
Configure Plan link and trigger build link incorrect in plan status gadget (passes in build number rather than plan number as parameter)
Fix when 'No plans selected.' appears in Bamboo Plans gadget

fields.description:
EBS volume creation, attachment & mounting is still depending on various variable timing from Amazon (especially when multiple volumes are stared simultaneously).

We should ensure that we cater for failure and perform retries for all commands.
fields.summary: Ensure that all commands when mounting EBS volumes handle failure recursively
Upgrade atlassian-user and atlassian-bucket
If jira not added as an oauth consumer gadget is just blank.

fields.description: Safari 4 is broken when editing the Build Configuration
fields.summary: Safari 4 is broken when editing the Build Configuration
Not very nice error if you don't select any plans in the charts gadget
Update plugin to not use sun's Base64Encoder
Unsupported feature: [atlassian.util] when adding gadget to igoogle (AG-939)
Missing oauth-related images in gadget

fields.description: Maven 2.1 uses the M2_HOME to resolve what to actually run regardless of where the ./bin is. If there are multiple Maven builders on the same box, this could be a problem
fields.summary: Maven 2.1 will not respect path if not already the default M2_HOME

fields.description: Can the order of agents please be sorted
fields.summary: Sort the view capabilities page lexicographically

fields.description:
If an external user has been deleted from LDAP etc 
and plans were set to notify watchers
and the user had a plan on his favourites

the user will still be notified via email
fields.summary: deleted (external) users get watcher notifications if they had plans on their favourite list.

fields.description: Get rid of dojo, yui
fields.summary: Update Bamboo to use jQuery

fields.description: Use Atlassian Hibernate instead of bucket. Confluence absorbed bucket and deleted it.
fields.summary: Use Atlassian Hibernate instead of bucket

fields.description: This feature is also provided by Apache's collection-commons 3.2 (we are using 3.1), so once we upgrade this functionality can be removed.
fields.summary: Add null-safe isEmpty and isNotEmpty methods to com.atlassian.bamboo.util.CollectionUtils
Rendering issue on home screen when plan name cannot be wrapped

fields.description:
I favourite a plan because I want that plan to show up in the "My Bamboo" tab. However, this does not mean that I want to be emailed about every failure of that plan. Its made worse since notification settings are plan specific and then the emails that are received seem completely random.

The only way to stop Bamboo spamming me is to either turn off notifications or stop favouriting a plan, neither is ideal.

Bamboo should separate the concept of favourites from watchers.
fields.summary: Favourites and Watches should be different

fields.description: Plugins 2 xwork plugins are throwing ClassNotFoundExceptions, because although there is a PluginAwareConfiguration class in Bamboo that should work, it is not being used.
fields.summary: Plugins 2 xwork plugins throw ClassNotFoundException

fields.description: Round trip errors occur on the EC2/instance screen when an invalid number of instances are requested
fields.summary: Roundtrip error w/ input validation during EC2 instance startup

fields.description: when a lot of plans are selected the report page/graphs becomes unusable.
fields.summary: Report Graphs fails to scale as number of selected plans increases

fields.description:
For a given release, we now build 12 different products (Bamboo projects) each of which have four different build plans (hourly, daily, promote, comprehensive) = 48+ plans!      Bamboo does not currently have the ability to do "bulk" clone for creating ad setting up new plans for a new branch.  Therefore, we must  manually go through the Create Plan wizard to clone/tweak each plan for a new branch which is very tedious, error prone and time-consuming.  See the attachment for example of what our current build plan strategy looks like for a given project. 

I'd like to see a new Bamboo wizard feature that will allow us to clone several build plans across several projects from say "trunk" to "branches/newrelease" all at once.  I'd be prompted to answer a few questions/fields:

Target plan name prefix:      // this would be pre-pended to each new plan created to give a user-friendly context .  E.g.  "8.0.0"   would be prefixed to the cloned build plan name so that it would show up as "8.0.0 DAILY"

Target plan key prefix:     // This would be pre-pended to the new cloned plan key. Example:  "RELEASE800BRANCH"  would be pre-pended to the source plan key "DAILY" to make the new cloned plan key:  RELEASE800BRANCHDAILY


Target branch:    // This would be the name of the branch.  It would be exposed as new bamboo property that that would get substituted in the Source Repository, Builder, and other pages in the Configuration tab.  Example:   

Branch:   featurexyz  

This would allow bamboo.branchName to be embedded in the Source Repository like https://my.svn.server/product/foo/branches/$bamboo.branchName and also in the Builder like:   ant -Dbranch=$bamboo.branchName.

Q:  Is there a Bamboo API that exposes "Create Plan" objects that would allow us to automate this bulk clone from a command line  script? 


Thanks for advice/suggestions.
-Greg
fields.summary: Add a feature to allow bulk "clone" of  multiple build plans for a new branch

fields.description:
New system property _bamboo.svn.wc.format_ has been added. It can be specified via command line (_-Dbamboo.svn.wc.format_) and take values: "1.3", "1.4", "1.5", "1.6"
This option will set format for all newly created Subversion workspaces. It does not affect existing workspaces.
Please also make a note that option _bamboo.svn.compatibility.14_ is deprecated in favor of _bamboo.svn.wc.format_
fields.summary: Document usage of system option bamboo.svn.wc.format

fields.description:
download bamboo 23
disconnect internet
install

Problem occurs when Spring attempts to resolve http://activemq.apache.org/schema/core/activemq-core-5.2.0.xsd and it is unavailable.

{noformat}
2009-08-10 07:46:33,481 WARN [25094328@qtp-23268025-0] [XmlBeanDefinitionReader] Ignored XML validation warning                                                        
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: schema_reference.4: Failed to read schema document 'http://activemq.apache.org/schema/core/activemq-core-5.2.0.xsd', because 1) could not find the document; 2) the document could not be read; 3) the root element of the document is not <xsd:schema>.
{noformat}

Similar issue to https://issues.apache.org/activemq/browse/AMQ-1638

It'd be great to be able to patch it.
fields.summary: Cannot install Bamboo 2.3 without internet connection

fields.description:
if there is a null entry in author table for author_name then
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.validators.UniqueAuthorNameValidator.validate(UniqueAuthorNameValidator.java:44)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.validator.DefaultActionValidatorManager.validate(DefaultActionValidatorManager.java:190)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.validator.DefaultActionValidatorManager.validate(DefaultActionValidatorManager.java:97)
at com.opensymphony.xwork.validator.DefaultActionValidatorManager.validate(DefaultActionValidatorManager.java:84)
is thrown
when an alias is added for a user.

the null entry could be caused by a 3rd  party macro and we should be more defensive in UniqueAuthorNameValidator#validate
fields.summary: UniqueAuthorNameValidator throws NPE when reposoitory alias is added and table author contains {{null}} entries
Plugin - Add link to download Bamboo in the admin section for Bamboo Server Configuration

fields.description:
A bug in xwork and/or the JDK is causing Bamboo to fail to run in Cargo on OSX.  The bug is on line 139 and 165 of [com.opensymphony.xwork.util.ResourceScanner|http://svn.opensymphony.com/fisheye/browse/xwork/branches/xwork_1-2/src/java/com/opensymphony/xwork/util/ResourceScanner.java?r=1691] in the xwork 1.2.x branch.  This takes a URL that has been returned from {{ClassLoader.getResources()}}, converts it to a String and URL decodes it.  The problem is, at least on OSX, if if the path to the jarfile that resource lives in contains a "\+", that "\+" won't be url encoded, and so the decoder replaces it with a space.  This causes an exception to be thrown at line 190, because the path being passed to the {{JarFile}} constructor doesn't exist.  To make things worse, a bug in the finally clause on line 209 which checks if the wrong thing is null causes this exception to be lost, and an NPE to be thrown instead.

This problem shows itself particularly on OSX, which uses weird temp directories (eg, {{/var/folders/Sf/Sf4cBN1TFHeKxBY206ipp++++TM/\-Tmp\-/}}), and when running Bamboo in cargo, which installs tomcat into the tmp directory, and so the {{ResourceScanner}} fails when scanning the tomcat jars.

Discussions with Don said a similar problem has been encountered with plugins 2, and the solution was not to decode the URL, but do some other manual substitutions, because the content of the returned URLs varies greatly between JDKs on different platforms.
fields.summary: Bamboo fails to run in Cargo on OSX

fields.description:
Bamboo will not destory EBS volumes that it has created but was not able to mount. When starting an elastic instance it appears that it is possible for bamboo to create a volume and not mount it. For instance, this happened to me (BAM-4288):

{code}
+ ec2-attach-volume vol-b9fe14d0 --instance i-bd2538d4 --device /dev/sdh
Client.IncorrectState: Instance 'i-bd2538d4' is not 'running'.
++ exit
{code}

In this case, when we shut the agent down we still need to destroy the EBS so we don't have the manually manage the volumes. I would also be happy to destroy the volume when we detect that it could not be mounted.
fields.summary: Bamboo does not destroy EBS volumes that it is not able to mount.

fields.description:
Our build queue regularly has 20+ minutes worth of builds in it, and if an emergency build needs to get through we have a tendency to cancel the builds above it in the queue.

Canceling builds from the queue seems to result in no notification whatsoever, which can be confusing and frustrating if those builds were started manually and someone is waiting for them to complete.  Canceling builds that are currently running is even worse - it results in a failure error and half the time corrupts that build so it needs to be manually cleared out before it can run again.  It would help if one of these were true:

- there was a "move to top of queue" or "pause all builds and do this one immediately" button for each item in the queue

- builds could be temporarily paused instead of canceled

- notifications were sent out for builds in the queue that are manually canceled, at least to the person who started them if they were started manually

- builds that have been manually started were indicated in bold so it is obvious they are important and shouldn't be manually canceled
fields.summary: Move to top of queue button

fields.description: Clicking on "Re-order" in Build Queue view makes "View Build log" and "Stop Build" controls disappear in list of currently building builds
fields.summary: Controls disappearing in "Currently building" list

fields.description:
We have this:

* BuildA is triggered on the repository.
* BuildA triggers BuildB on success.
* BuildA time << BuildB time.

BuildA triggers BuildB. BuildA runs again before BuildB passes. BuildB will not be run again after it completes meaning it will not see the changes that triggered BuildA the second time.

It would be nice if bamboo kept a note that BuildA completed while BuildB was running and run BuildB again after it finishes. 

Maybe this could be a property on the dependency between BuildA and BuildB. In JIRA we would not need the repository version to be kept, we just want the build to kick off again (though keeping the repository version would be nice).
fields.summary: Build trigger forgotten when dependent build currently running.

fields.description:
n the JIRA team we have a developerment rule that says you cant checkin when the build is RED. But its more complicated than that.

We have a series of defined builds (1.6 unit tests and func test batch builds) that make up the check in rule.

We sue a greasy monkey script to "collate" these builds as green or red and then show a big green box when the collective state of all these defined builds is green.

it would be great if we could define that in Bamboo. Imagine we had a "arbitary build groups" and then have bamboo answer the question "is this build group GREEN?"

This could then be used by the IDE connectors such that on checkin it could ask a defined "build group" if its cool to check in right now.

Plus customers would not need Greasy Monkey scripts to work this out either.

This is not really related to chained builds.  This is an arbitary collections of builds that are defined by the customer as beeing GREEN or RED
fields.summary: Allow logical groups of builds to be define and then have Bamboo report Green/Red depending on the state of all the builds in the group

fields.description:
When importing a large instance during setup no activity indication is displayed.

Bamboo UI should indicate that the import is in progress.

A user not staring at the logs may get bored and click around or think bamboo is hung.
fields.summary: Bamboo to display an activity indication during import step in setup wizard

Add ability to change build configuration on the fly prior to kicking off a build via the UI

Perhaps we can have an additional pre-build step before building, where the user is prompted with a build launch screen to edit/confirm the plan configuration for the next build.
fields.summary: Add a Build Launch Screen to manual build process

fields.description:
We have the need to pull the current build number from Bamboo into a file that is distributed as part of our software. This allows us to view what build a customer is using when we get support issues (through a Help/About window).

We have tried using 'getLatestBuildResults.action' in our build script, but this returns the PREVIOUS build details not the CURRENT build.

This would be a great feature for us, and hope you'll consider implementation.

h3. Solution
In order to refer to the Bamboo build number please use {{${bamboo.buildNumber}}} build variable.
fields.summary: Get current (running) build details

fields.description: I've attached the dependency tree for an Atlassian plugin that imports bamboo-web 2.3-rc1-r2.  Bamboo web is pulling in atlassian-core 3.6, indirectly through atlassian johnson.  atlassian-core 3.6 does not include the com.atlassian.core.i18n package, so if the plugin defines action that extends BambooActionSupport, the compilation will fail saying that com.atlassian.core.i18n cannot be found.  The work around for this is to explicitly define a dependency on atlassian-core 4.5 in dependency managament section of the plugins pom, the fix is for Bamboo web to explicitly defining this dependency, if that's what it depends on.
fields.summary: Maven builds importing bamboo web get atlassian-core 3.6

fields.description:
Bamboo seems to be able to think that it is still running builds on an agent that is shutdown. The build does not appear that it wants to finish. It is not even possible to stop the build using the web UI.

Check out https://jbac/browse/BASIC-JDK15/log  (BASIC-JDK15-5331)

It appears that the agent got killed in the middle of the checkout if this helps.
fields.summary: Bamboo still seems to be running build on elastic agent that was shut down.
